main event: A witness in Pataskala, Ohio observed a UFO for approximately 55 minutes on October 21, 1966.
interesting points: The object could stop in mid-air and 'hover', and it did so frequently.
The object could take off and reach an unbelievable speed in no time, and it could make 90-degree turns without any 'skid' or 'slide'.
The object had three 'headlights' that shone out of the bottom and flashed on and off, as if it was 'watching' the witness.
The witness and another party felt that the object was not out to harm them and experienced a 'strange primitive feeling' when it was closest to them.
The object was described as a dark, brownish, metallic gray object, approximately the size of 'two good-sized dinner plates and one shallow bowl' placed on top of each other.
sighted object: a dark, brownish, metallic gray object with three 'headlights'
witnesses: one witness, with another party also observing the object
